ax.ha.it.smsalarm

Class LogHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ax.ha.it.smsalarm.LogHandler

  • public class LogHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for all logging. This means logging to LogCat, errlog.txt and alarms.html.
    LogHandler is a singleton.
    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2.1.3
    Author:
    Robert Nyholm

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LogHandler.LogPriorities
      Enumeration for different LogPriorities needed to decide which kind of logging we're suppose to do.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static LogHandler getInstance()
        Method to get the singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:
        Singleton instance of LogHandler

      • logCat

        public void logCat(LogHandler.LogPriorities priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message)
        Method to create a LogCat log message. If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Logpriority as LogPriorities
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        See Also:
        logCat(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable), logTxt(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable)

      • logCat

        public void logCat(LogHandler.LogPriorities priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message,
          java.lang.Throwable thr)
        Method to create a LogCat log message with throwable object If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Logriority as LogPriorities
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        thr - Throwable object
        See Also:
        logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), logTxt(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable)

      • logTxt

        public void logTxt(LogHandler.LogPriorities priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message)
        Method to store a log message to file. If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Throws different exceptions depending on error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Logpriority as LogPriorities
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        See Also:
        logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), logCat(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable), checkDirAndFile(File, File, File, String), checkExternalStorageState()

      • logTxt

        public void logTxt(LogHandler.LogPriorities priority,
          java.lang.String logTag,
          java.lang.String message,
          java.lang.Throwable thr)
        Method to store a log message and throwable to file. If no valid priority value are given it will log a message with ERROR priority with the origin log message and current error.
        Throws different exceptions depending on error.
        Parameters:
        priority - Logpriority as LogPriorities
        logTag - Log tag as string
        message - Log message
        thr - Throwable object
        See Also:
        logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), logCat(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable), #checkDirAndFile(File, File, File, STring), checkExternalStorageState()

      • getAlarmLogPath

        public java.lang.String getAlarmLogPath()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        To return complete path to the alarm log file. Throws exception if alarm log file doesn't exist or if external storage isn't available for reading.
        Returns:
        Full path to alarm log file as string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If alarm log file doesn't exist or if external storage isn't available for reading

      • logAlarm

        public void logAlarm(java.util.List<Alarm> alarms,
            Context context)
        Method to write alarm log file as an .html file.
        Parameters:
        alarms - List of objects to be written to file
        context - Context for retrieving Android resources
        See Also:
        checkExternalStorageState(), checkDirAndFile(File, File, File, String), ax.ha.it.smsalarm.Alarm, logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable)

                   java.io.File saFile,
                   java.io.File file,
                   java.lang.String fileName)
        Method to check if needed directory or file for application exist, if not theyr'e created.
        Parameters:
        saDir - Path and name of directory as File
        saFile - Path and name of file as File
        file - File object used to create a new file or directory
        fileName - Name of file that will be created

      • checkExternalStorageState

        private void checkExternalStorageState()
        This method checks the state of external storage media and decides whether its available for reading and writing, only reading, only writing or not available at all.
